alert.note: Alert for Carter (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 3:36PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky, southeast Ohio and West Virginia, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Carter and Greenup. In southeast Ohio, Gallia, Lawrence, Meigs and Washington. In West Virginia, Jackson, Mason, Pleasants, Ritchie, Tyler, Wirt and Wood. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 335 PM EST, gauge reports indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Parkersburg, Ashland, Ironton, Belpre, Point Pleasant, Grayson, Gallipolis, Coal Grove, St. Marys, Pomeroy, Olive Hill, Middlebourne, Racine, Forked Run State Park, Lake Vesuvius, Carter Caves State Park, Vienna, Ravenswood, Paden City and New Haven. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
